snippet: The plan from T-Mobile USA to allow unlimited streaming of some video services may become the first test of the government’s rules to prevent favoritism on the Internet.
abstract: T-Mobile USA announces plan that will allow unlimited streaming of some video services regardless of limits on data; plan could be first test of Federal Communications Commission's net neutrality rules.
lead_paragraph: The plan from T-Mobile USA to allow unlimited streaming of some video services may become the first test of the government’s rules to prevent favoritism on the Internet.

headline.main: T-Mobile Video Plan Could Test F.C.C.’s New Net Neutrality Rules
headline.print_headline: T-Mobile Video Plan Could Test F.C.C.’s New Net Neutrality Rules
